intro: Goniothalamus elmeri var. longipedicellatus, commonly known as the longipedicellate goniothalamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, smooth leaves. It typically grows as an understory tree in humid, tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
